messages.content: ComfyUI_Pops is a custom node in ComfyUI that uses the pOpsPaper method for photo-inspired diffusion operators.
The pOpsPaper method is a technique from the pOpsPaper repository that uses diffusion operators inspired by photos to generate images.
To install ComfyUI_Pops, navigate to the ./ComfyUI/custom_node directory and run the command: git clone https://github.com/smthemex/ComfyUI_Pops.git
What are the requirements for running ComfyUI_Pops?
To run ComfyUI_Pops, you need to install the required packages by running: pip install -r requirements.txt
What models are needed for ComfyUI_Pops?
ComfyUI_Pops requires the following models: kandinsky-community/kandinsky-2-2-prior, kandinsky-community/kandinsky-2-2-decoder, and four models from pOpsPaper/operators.
Yes, ComfyUI_Pops can be used offline by placing the required models in the appropriate directories under ComfyUI/models.
What are some examples of using ComfyUI_Pops?

Examples of using ComfyUI_Pops include the object2texture model for generating object textures, the object scene model for generating object scenes, and the drop cond model for removing certain conditions.
How many custom nodes are listed in the ComfyUI_Pops documentation?
The ComfyUI_Pops documentation lists 20 custom nodes, including ComfyUI_ParlerTTS, ComfyUI_Llama3_8B, ComfyUI_HiDiffusion_Pro, and more.
